Class NSALoginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • NSALoginController

  • public final class NSALoginController
extends java.lang.Object
    The NSALoginController class handles password hashing and verification for the User class.

    It contains only static methods, and therefore maintains no state. Another example of a class containing only static methods is Java's built-in Math class.

    Notice the interesting formatting used in this comment block. This special formatting is called Javadocs and is used by Java IDEs to automatically generate documentation for classes.

    Many Java IDEs will help you automatically generate the formatting for the Javadoc comments.

    Javadocs are widely used in industry, and if you work for a company that uses Java code, you will almost certainly be expected to include Javadocs in your own code, so it's a good habit to develop.

    You can use the javadoc tool to generate fancy HTML files. For example:

    javadoc *.java -d ./doc

    Then you can open the index.html file in the doc directory.

    For more information about how to write javadocs see:

    Javadoc Tutorial

    For more information about when to write javadocs see these Stack Overflow posts:

    • Do you use Javadoc for every method you write?
    • Simple Getter/Setter comments
    • Javadoc comments vs block comments?
    • Javadoc for private/protected methods?
    Since:
    2016-12-08 This code was adapted from this Stack Overflow post.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void hashUserPassword(User user)
      This function takes the password from the User class and hashes it.
      static java.lang.Boolean verifyPassword(User user)
      This function uses the password and salt in the User to generate a hash, then compares that hash to the original hash value.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • hashUserPassword

        public static void hashUserPassword(User user)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This function takes the password from the User class and hashes it. As a side-effect, the original password value is removed for security purposes.
        Parameters:
        user - The user whose password needs to be hashed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is a problem with the chosen hash function.

      • verifyPassword

        public static java.lang.Boolean verifyPassword(User user)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This function uses the password and salt in the User to generate a hash, then compares that hash to the original hash value.
        Parameters:
        user - The user whose password needs to be hashed.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the password values match.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is a problem with the chosen hash function.
